nodes.bodyText:
I don't understand how this is any different from the code before. for(X : Y) is invoking Y.iterator() and looping through it.
What am I missing?

FWIW, I get the same failure with the new code (my line numbers will be different):
    java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
        at java.util.IdentityHashMap$IdentityHashMapIterator.nextIndex(IdentityHashMap.java:735)
        at java.util.IdentityHashMap$KeyIterator.next(IdentityHashMap.java:826)
        at java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableCollection$1.next(Collections.java:1044)
        at io.pravega.shared.metrics.StatsProviderImpl.startWithoutExporting(StatsProviderImpl.java:85)
        at io.pravega.shared.metrics.StatsProviderProxy.startWithoutExporting(StatsProviderProxy.java:45)
        at io.pravega.shared.metrics.MetricsProviderTest.setUp(MetricsProviderTest.java:35)

Is this test working on some machines?
the latest change fixes it for me: io.pravega.shared.metrics.MetricsProviderTest > testGauge PASSED
